description.narrative: In line with the OCS and Humanitarian Advocacy Strategy, Oxfam#s standalone influencing activities will center on the following thematic areas: 1. Women#s Empowerment: addressing the deep and widespread gender gap, particularly foregrounding the influence of women#s rights organisations. 2. Localisation of Aid: agitating for change related to the persistent barriers towards localisation of aid in both humanitarian and development fields, in close alliance with local and national partners. 3. Debt Relief: in collaboration with the Debt Working Group, seeking expedited, full debt cancellation for Somalia at the highest levels. 4. Youth Empowerment: addressing the specific needs, challenges and aspiration of youth, particularly in terms of influence in decision-making, education and employment. 5. Protection: leveraging our humanitarian presence to identify key protection issues and influence for change, while also feeding into broader protection work, such as with the Regional Durable Solutions Secretariat.

participating-org.narrative:
Since 1993, World Vision has been working in areas of Somalia with the highest levels of child poverty. Our goal is to achieve long-lasting benefits in the quality of life for vulnerable children and their families, displaced persons, and communities using a development approach that increases participation, understanding and unity among people of different cultures while promoting the rightsand interests of Somali children.
In response to the humanitarian needs of the Somali people, World Vision designs and delivers programs coordinated at regional and country levels by dedicated staff that provides strategic and operational support. Our program offices are located close to communities so our teams can be responsive to the needs of local children and their families at the community level.
Following the 2011 famine and more than 20 years since the collapse of the central government, strong signs of hope areemerging for sustained peace, and the opportunity for families to live healthy, prosperous lives. World Vision is committed to walking with communities from emergency through rehabilitative programming in order to bring about sustainable and long-term change overthe coming years.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
